title: Ticket #5102: Merge various blahp codebases
description: For the 8.5 series, we'd like to review the differences between the OSG-shipped blahp and the UW-shipped blahp and get things down to a single code base.

2016-Apr-06 15:41:09 by dweitzel:
I'm not sure there is a way to exactly tell the changes in a concise way between the OSG blahp and HTCondor's Blahp. I counted, and there are 1243 commits to OSG's blahp since we forked the blahp from upstream.

We know that the OSG has (almost) all of the changes that HTCondor implements in patches. See spreadsheet above.

We should probably have another meeting on this topic, but my suggested next step is to set HTCondor's blahp upstream to OSG's blahp. Test, test, test, and release.

2016-Apr-26 11:47:31 by dweitzel:
Adding blahp.diff. The massive diff between HTCondor's blahp (post patches, V8_5_4-branch, e92402eeee) and OSG's Blahp (v1_18_bosco, 9b2bcbb8).

Quick summary stats:

  • ~6k lines in diff.
  • The two blahps where forked from upstream almost exactly 1 year apart, HTCondor: 2011/02/07, OSG: 2012/02/06

I'll add more analysis after reading deeply through the diff.

2016-Apr-26 15:57:07 by dweitzel:
After reading through the diff, I have these conclusions:

  1. There are many, many changes.
  2. Most of the changes are to parts of the blahp that are not used in either HTCondor or the OSG, and for which I cannot speak knowledgeably about. For example, the changes to the blupdater, which is a daemon that is not run in either HTCondor or OSG when the blahp is used. Most of these changes seem to be because of the difference in when HTCondor and the OSG forked from upstream. There are small changes in server.c, but otherwise the compiled files are largely untouched from upstream.
  3. About 1/4 of the changes are to the scripts used to communicate with the local scheduler, which are used by both HTCondor and the OSG. There are some differences to the base scripts such as blah_common_submit_functions.sh, but they are minor.
  4. The differences of the scripts between HTCondor and OSG are isolated. Mostly, I can point to the OSG scripts as having more up to date logic. For example, the OSG's pbs_submit.sh correctly submits PBSPro jobs with the select statement, HTCondor's does not.

2019-May-10 16:14:43 by blin:
The OSG/HTCondor teams had a meeting to discuss next steps and this is what we came up with:

  1. Create a CHTC BLAH git repo cloned from https://github.com/opensciencegrid/BLAH (this contains all HTCondor patches except the blahp -> batch_gahp and m4 changes).
    1. We'll use the 'devel' branch as our main branch for work based off the OSG 'v1_18_bosco' branch. The idea being that we'd have 'devel' and 'stable' branches that would align with the HTCondor development/stable series.
    2. For the time being, flightworthy will continue to build the blahp as an external with the remaining patches using a tarball generated off of tags from this git repo. We should continue with the OSG versioning scheme, dropping the {{.bosco}} suffix.
  2. Use blahp instead of batch_gahp. Some work is required to transition existing installations using batch_gahp config to blahp.
  3. Set up GitHub forwarding with https://github.com/prelz/BLAH as the upstream
  4. Pull the blahp into HTCondor proper. We noted two options, which we can decide on based on build-system support:
    1. Drop the blahp under src/ in the HTCondor repo as a git submodule. It was noted that 'git archive' does not automatically populate submodules.
    2. Add the blahp tarball as a secondary source in the packaging and drop things in at build time.

Great! But before we completely rip out the blahp external, we'll need to sort out the Debian and tarball packaging. How's that work going?

2019-Jun-28 17:41:50 by edquist:
>How about dat Debian and tarball packaging?

I was focused first on getting successful builds of the blahp and condor without the blahp. I started down the path of debian packaging tutorials, and taking a look at the existing debian packaging in the condor source repo - but I have not gone far.

I discussed the topic with TimT also and note a few things:

1. The current debian builds are PROPER and (thus) do not include the blahp.

This isn't to say that we should not also package the blahp, but it is worth noting that anyone using the current debian packaging of condor is apparently not using the blahp.

2. Who uses the blahp? Who uses the tarballs? (Bosco?)

3. Based on Miron's direction from last Friday's meeting, we want to get out of the business of bundling everything with condor. TimT suggested that this probably means the tarball too - thus, no blahp in the tarballs.

However, if the tarballs are used by people who can't install system packages and also still use the blahp, perhaps we still need some kind of tarball solution for them.

Can we make a separate tarball for the blahp, rather than including in it condor's?
